issue.title: google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.co.jp/index.html?zx=1763826810772&no_sw_cr=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.co.jp%2Findex.html%3Fzx%3D1763826810772%26no_sw_cr%3D1) ### Comment > I would like to report an issue Ive noticed with AdGuard DNS filtering. However, I wasnt sure where I should submit the report, so I ended up posting it on an unrelated website. I apologize for that. > The issue is that the battery consumption of DNS filtering suddenly increased. For example, in the past ten days, its background battery usage had consistently been below 1%, but today it unexpectedly rose to around 40%. Although I understand there can be some fluctuation, it has typically been no more than around 5%. That is why I decided to report the issue. ### Screenshots

issue.title: google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.co.jp/index.html?zx=1763826810772&no_sw_cr=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.co.jp%2Findex.html%3Fzx%3D1763826810772%26no_sw_cr%3D1) ### Comment > I would like to report an issue Ive noticed with AdGuard DNS filtering. However, I wasnt sure where I should submit the report, so I ended up posting it on an unrelated website. I apologize for that. > The issue is that the battery consumption of DNS filtering suddenly increased. For example, in the past ten days, its background battery usage had consistently been below 1%, but today it unexpectedly rose to around 40%. Although I understand there can be some fluctuation, it has typically been no more than around 5%. That is why I decided to report the issue. ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body: @BlazDT As the reporter commented, this is a self-promotion. I'll move to Annoyances. I also don't think `##div:has(> h3:first-child + div:last-child > a[href*="/subscription"])` should be hidden.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://news.web.nhk/newsweb/na/na-k10014984351000](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.web.nhk%2Fnewsweb%2Fna%2Fna-k10014984351000) ### Comment > It is desirable that this issue be handled (or at least reviewed) by a person having basic knowledge about the NHK and its behavior in Japan. > > Viewers can read the full article or watch the movie only after they consent and give some personal information to the form. > The same form appears on the main domain `www.web.nhk` and subdomains, for example we cannot play the video on `https://edu.web.nhk/school/watch/clip/?das_id=D0005402927_00000` > > I'm not sure it is technically possible for AdGuard to deal with this type of annoyance, but if possible, > the problem is that the NHK is so greedy it would pursue legal action against website visitors who don't have a "receiver contract". > Setting aside whether the NHK can win such a ridiculous lawsuit, you could say that it would be dangerous for a Japanese to view its pages without any VPN if the form is skipped somehow, so I think the filtering rules should be only available to those who clearly wish them. ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body: I agree on hiding the top banner leading to registration, but `##div:has(> h3:first-child + div:last-child > a[href*="/subscription"])` hides the same link in the page map at the bottom of the page that only shows user that the site has a registration page. I don't think this should be hidden.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://data.service.paypal.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdata.service.paypal.com) ### Comment > ! Unable to log in when receiving account statements from PayPal via Gmail (https://mail.google.com/) > ! comment.body: The same report reporting as Social Widget and apparently by the same reporter: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/207947 TBH I don't think this should be hidden, but apparently the reporter wants to remove the leftover? The page will be shown after you published your blog post and is suggesting to share the article. Shouldn't such a page, I mean a dedicated page to share contents, be left to User rules?

issue.title: news.web.nhk
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://news.web.nhk/newsweb/na/na-k10014984351000](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.web.nhk%2Fnewsweb%2Fna%2Fna-k10014984351000) ### Comment > It is desirable that this issue be handled (or at least reviewed) by a person having basic knowledge about the NHK and its behavior in Japan. > > Viewers can read the full article or watch the movie only after they consent and give some personal information to the form. > The same form appears on the main domain `www.web.nhk` and subdomains, for example we cannot play the video on `https://edu.web.nhk/school/watch/clip/?das_id=D0005402927_00000` > > I'm not sure it is technically possible for AdGuard to deal with this type of annoyance, but if possible, > the problem is that the NHK is so greedy it would pursue legal action against website visitors who don't have a "receiver contract". > Setting aside whether the NHK can win such a ridiculous lawsuit, you could say that it would be dangerous for a Japanese to view its pages without any VPN if the form is skipped somehow, so I think the filtering rules should be only available to those who clearly wish them. ### Screenshots

issue.title: news.web.nhk
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://news.web.nhk/newsweb/na/na-k10014984351000](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.web.nhk%2Fnewsweb%2Fna%2Fna-k10014984351000) ### Comment > It is desirable that this issue be handled (or at least reviewed) by a person having basic knowledge about the NHK and its behavior in Japan. > > Viewers can read the full article or watch the movie only after they consent and give some personal information to the form. > The same form appears on the main domain `www.web.nhk` and subdomains, for example we cannot play the video on `https://edu.web.nhk/school/watch/clip/?das_id=D0005402927_00000` > > I'm not sure it is technically possible for AdGuard to deal with this type of annoyance, but if possible, > the problem is that the NHK is so greedy it would pursue legal action against website visitors who don't have a "receiver contract". > Setting aside whether the NHK can win such a ridiculous lawsuit, you could say that it would be dangerous for a Japanese to view its pages without any VPN if the form is skipped somehow, so I think the filtering rules should be only available to those who clearly wish them. ### Screenshots

comment.body: I knew there was an issue here. I tried again today and now the video doesn't work.....again.... Its got a different message this time: Here is the filtering log: [LOG.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23834208/LOG.json) This issue requires thorough investigation, as the video works one day and fails the next. What exactly is causing this inconsistency? The unpredictability is extremely frustrating.

issue.title: news.web.nhk
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://news.web.nhk/newsweb/na/na-k10014984351000](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnews.web.nhk%2Fnewsweb%2Fna%2Fna-k10014984351000) ### Comment > It is desirable that this issue be handled (or at least reviewed) by a person having basic knowledge about the NHK and its behavior in Japan. > > Viewers can read the full article or watch the movie only after they consent and give some personal information to the form. > The same form appears on the main domain `www.web.nhk` and subdomains, for example we cannot play the video on `https://edu.web.nhk/school/watch/clip/?das_id=D0005402927_00000` > > I'm not sure it is technically possible for AdGuard to deal with this type of annoyance, but if possible, > the problem is that the NHK is so greedy it would pursue legal action against website visitors who don't have a "receiver contract". > Setting aside whether the NHK can win such a ridiculous lawsuit, you could say that it would be dangerous for a Japanese to view its pages without any VPN if the form is skipped somehow, so I think the filtering rules should be only available to those who clearly wish them. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/63sdh1v5lpk4cg8gkkgk4skscc480s8mp96zgphvr4.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/d0igyd6getc08440c0s0gwsw44s0sk8ib00tcbyvb4.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 3 ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/7ijcio8i7iwwc80o0s08gwcgsgw8k0w5cwhuce9sxs.png?nc=1)

Hide your User-Agent,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
